other_tests.findings: The biopsies of typical facial papules revealed a basal cell carcinoma (BCC) with follicular differentiation. The lesions showed a relatively well-circumscribed basaloid neoplasm composed of buds and cords of neoplastic cells arranged in an anastomosing fashion with scant stroma. Biopsies of crusted or ulcerated lesions on the nose revealed a more aggressive and infiltrative type of BCC.

other_tests.procedure_name: Genetic mutational analysis for PTCH gene
other_tests.findings: No sequence changes that could be interpreted as being associated with BCNS were identified. Heterozygosity for a silent polymorphism in exon 5 (Ala239Ala; GCG/GCT) was present.
Referring to removal of a more aggressive and infiltrative type of BCC.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The patient did well after surgery, and although complete clearing of basaloid neoplasms was not possible, the more aggressive tumors were removed.

other_tests.findings: Showed basaloid proliferation but no basal cell carcinoma.
